content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check the Apple Store for the availability of the latest iPhone model and schedule an in-store pickup at the nearest Apple Store for January 10, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The task requires checking for the latest iPhone (which is the iPhone 17 Pro based on the central banner) and scheduling an in-store pickup. To proceed, I need to navigate to the iPhone section to look into availability and pickup options. Clicking on the "iPhone" menu should provide links or info for purchasing and pickup.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model is the iPhone 17 Pro, which is shown as "New." To check availability and proceed with scheduling an in-store pickup, I need to select the iPhone 17 Pro so that I can access purchasing and pickup options.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The iPhone 17 Pro promotional page has loaded, but I don't yet see options for checking availability or scheduling an in-store pickup. I need to scroll down to find purchase options or options to schedule a pickup at a nearby Apple Store.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is a "Pre-order" button for the iPhone 17 Pro, which likely leads to the purchase flow, including pickup options. To check availability and schedule an in-store pickup, I'll click "Pre-order".
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am now on the iPhone 17 Pro pre-order page, but I do not yet see specific options for pickup or to progress in the pre-order process. I should scroll down further to find the purchase/configuration flow where pickup store selection usually appears.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There are options to select between iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max as well as an option to "Pick up from Store" at the top right. This is likely where the store pickup scheduling flow starts. I should click the "Pick up from Store" option.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The pre-order flow is showing color options for the iPhone 17 Pro. I should proceed by selecting a color, as this is usually required before scheduling a store pickup. The colors available seem to be at [18], [19], and [20]. I'll select the first color option.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The color "Silver" has been selected for the iPhone 17 Pro. The next likely step is to proceed with the configuration or checkout process. There isn't a visible "Next" button on this part of the flow, so I should scroll further down to find storage selection, pickup scheduling, or checkout confirmation.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage option selection is now visible. To proceed with the purchase and reach the step where I can schedule an in-store pickup, I'll need to pick a storage capacity. I'll select the base model, "256GB", which is at [1].
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The 256GB storage option is now selected. To continue with the purchase process and find the in-store pickup scheduling option, I need to proceed further in the checkout or configuration flow, which likely continues below.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.78
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Apple Trade In step is present, requiring me to select whether to trade in a device or not. For faster progress to the pickup step, I'll choose "No trade-in" at [5].
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: "No trade-in" is now selected. The next steps in the purchasing/checkout flow should appear below, such as choosing payment/pickup options. I should scroll down to find the in-store pickup scheduling interface.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The payment options are displayed. To proceed towards scheduling an in-store pickup, I need to select a payment method. I'll choose "Buy" (paying full price) at [1] to keep the process simple and quick.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Buy" payment option has been selected. The next section, "Connectivity," asks to choose a carrier, which is required before proceeding to the pickup scheduling step. I will pick "AT&T" at [10] to continue.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "AT&T" carrier and "Buy" option are both selected. At the top right, there is a "Pick up from Store" button ([1]), which looks like the next step to check store availability and schedule an in-store pickup. 
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The interface has not changed, and it appears the "Pick up from Store" option is already highlighted or in use, since store pickup time frame ("2-3 weeks") is displayed next to it. To move forward in the scheduling or location selection process for pickup, I should scroll down to look for further steps about choosing the actual store location and date.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.94

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: "iPhone 17 Pro";	[1]: "Pick up from Store";	[7]: "How does AppleCare work?";	[8]: "Explore the features and coverage of AppleCare. Fees and deductibles apply.";	[9]: <button> "Show more";	[10]: <button> "";

content:
Thought: The AppleCare insurance options section is visible now, but there is still no interface for store selection or date scheduling. The page likely continues the flow beneath this section, so I should keep scrolling to find where to pick a store and a pickup date.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.95

content:
Thought: The "iPhone Availability" pop-up allows searching for local Apple Stores by city or zip code. To proceed with store selection and schedule a pickup for January 10, 2024, I need to enter my city or zip code in the input field [0] to find the nearest Apple Store.
Action: Type [0]; [enter city or zip code]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.98
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: I am at the "iPhone Availability" pop-up. The textbox [0] is where I should input a city or zip code to check Apple Store availability for pickup. I need to enter a sample city or zip code in this field for the system to find the nearest Apple Store.
Action: Type [0]; New York, NY
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.99
